snippet: The parks system has $143 million from the state, the federal government and private grants to address maintenance and infrastructure projects deferred for years.
abstract: New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation is using a $143 million infusion from state and federal funds as well as private grants, the largest single allocation of capital money in the history of the state's park system, to address maintenance and infrastructure projects that have been deferred for years.
lead_paragraph: The parks system has $143 million from the state, the federal government and private grants to address maintenance and infrastructure projects deferred for years.

headline.seo: New York State Parks Use Infusion of Money Toward Backlog of Repairs
headline.main: New York State Parks Use Infusion of Money Toward Backlog of Repairs
headline.print_headline: At State Parks, $143 Million Infusion Goes Toward Tackling Overdue Repairs
